Custody in sovereign systems is not merely a technical responsibility; it is a formative practice. Holding private keys, managing key pairs, rotating identities, and accepting the limits of deletion reshape behavior and posture. This chapter argues that custody is not paranoia, nor ideology, but disciplineâ€”one that forms character through responsibility, restraint, and deliberate authorship.

## ðŸ”’ Building Continuum - Chapter 15 â€” Custody as Spiritual Discipline

Custody in sovereign systems is not merely a technical responsibility; it is a formative practice. Holding private keys, managing key pairs, rotating identities, and accepting the limits of deletion reshape behavior and posture. This chapter argues that custody is not paranoia, nor ideology, but disciplineâ€”one that forms character through responsibility, restraint, and deliberate authorship.
